info.title: intelliHR Public API
info.description: You can find developer's guide and more documentation on [https://developers.intellihr.io](https://developers.intellihr.io)

ApiKey.description: You can generate and delete API keys through your intelliHR portal. API keys should be sent as `Authorization: Bearer <key>`
ApiKey.name: Authorization

id.title: UUIDv4
id.description: The identifier string for the [Business Entity](#tag/Business-Entities).

name.description: Name given to this [Business Entity](#tag/Business-Entities). This name would normally be shown to users of the system.

code.description: Code given to this [Business Entity](#tag/Business-Entities)

legalName.description: Legal name can be different from the name presented to a user. Usually used for administrative tasks.

number.description: Legally registered [Business Entity](#tag/Business-Entities) number, e.g. in Australia this might be the ABN, or in America the RN.

isEnabled.description: Specifies whether users can select this [Business Entity](#tag/Business-Entities) in dropdowns.

customFields.description: The custom field values for this [Business Entity](#tag/Business-Entities)

meta.description: Contains miscellaneous meta information about the response.

asAt.title: RFC3339 datetime
asAt.description: The point in time for which this response is for. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

requestId.title: UUIDv4
requestId.description: The identifier string for the api request.

name.description: Name given to this [Business Entity](#tag/Business-Entities). This name would normally be shown to users of the system.

code.description: Code given to this [Business Entity](#tag/Business-Entities)

legalName.description: Legal name can be different from the name presented to a user. Usually used for administrative tasks.

number.description: Legally registered [Business Entity](#tag/Business-Entities) number, e.g. in Australia this might be the ABN, or in America the RN.

isEnabled.description: Specifies whether users can select this [Business Entity](#tag/Business-Entities) in dropdowns.

customFields.description: The custom field values for this [Business Entity](#tag/Business-Entities)

additionalProperties.description: Custom fields will be keyed by their api_name. Custom fields are not required, and any existing model defined custom fields will default to having null values.

value.description: The value for this custom field. This value structure will depend upon the type of the custom field.

anyOf.description: The value will be null when a custom field is not provided or is empty for a record. Null can be provided to delete a custom field value.
For TEXT and NUMBER records, the value is stored as a string with the value of the record.

label.description: For SINGLE_SELECT records, the value is stored as an object with the label of the dropdown option. NOTE: Only the label needs to be provided. `id` is not required.

labels.description: For MULTI_SELECT records, the value is stored as an object with an array of labels for all selected options. NOTE: Only the labels need to be provided. `ids` is not required.

person.description:
For PEOPLE_DROPDOWN records, the value is an object with an array of the [Person](#tag/People) search object and their [Job](#tag/Jobs) search object. This [Person](#tags/people) is specified as a search object, which will match the person who best fits the keys for this object.
      Multiple keys can be used together to further narrow search results (for example, if there are multiple people with the same name, email address
      can be used as well to limit to a single person. A validation error will be thrown if this search is unable to be narrowed to a single [Person](#tags/people).

id.title: UUIDv4
id.description: The identifier string for the [Person](#tags/people) to locate in the system.

name.description: The name of the [Person](#tags/people) in intelliHR to search for. Note that the search accounts for differences in name order automatically.

primaryEmailAddress.description: The email address flagged as primary for the [Person](#tags/people) within the system.

employeeNumber.description: A manually entered employee number that identifies a [Person](#tags/people) in intelliHR. It may be hidden in the system's UI depending upon your tenant's configuration.

autoIncrementIntellihrId.description: An autogenerated number that uniquely identifies a [Person](#tags/people) in intelliHR. It may be hidden in the system's UI depending upon your tenant's configuration.

autoIncrementingIntellihrId.description: An autogenerated number that uniquely identifies a [Person](#tags/people) in intelliHR. It may be hidden in the system's UI depending upon your tenant's configuration.

job.description: The [Job](#tag/Jobs) information of the [Person](#tag/People) is mandatory if the target PEOPLE_DROPDOWN custom field allows selecting individual jobs. If not, The [Job](#tag/Jobs) information is not mandatory.

id.title: UUIDv4
id.description: The identifier string for the [Job](#tag/Job) of this [Job](#tag/Jobs).

name.description: The name/position title of the [Job](#tag/Jobs).

id.title: UUIDv4
id.description: The identifier string for the [Custom Field Definition](#tag/Custom-Field-Definitions).

name.description: Name given to this [Custom Field Definition](#tag/Custom-Field-Definitions). This name would normally be shown to users of the system.

apiName.description: The api name given to this [Custom Field Definition](#tag/Custom-Field-Definitions). This name is used to uniquely identify the custom field in the api and is used as the key when modifying the custom field on a record.

isEnabled.description: Whether or not this [Custom Field Definition](#tag/Custom-Field-Definitions) is enabled to be used.

isSensitive.description: Whether or not this [Custom Field Definition](#tag/Custom-Field-Definitions) is marked as sensitive information.

description.description: The description of this [Custom Field Definition](#tag/Custom-Field-Definitions). This is used as a tooltip on the create and update pages.
description.example: This field is used to describe the custom field.

modelType.description: The model that this custom field relates to and can be attached to. Enum: `ADDRESS`, `BUSINESS_ENTITY`, `BUSINESS_UNIT`, `EMAIL_ADDRESS`, `JOB`, `LOCATION`, `PERSON`, `POSITION_TITLE`, `PHONE_NUMBER`, `REMUNERATION`, `TRAINING`.

type.description: The type of data this field records. Enum: `SINGLE_SELECT`, `MULTI_SELECT`, `TEXT`, `NUMBER`, `PEOPLE_DROPDOWN`.

definitions.title: Definitions
definitions.description: This key's values change depending on the "type" key. It is used to store additional information pertinent to that key. For more information on custom field configurations, see our [knowledge base article on custom fields](https://intellihr.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/4402637180303-Custom-Fields)

id.title: UUIDv4
id.description: The identifier string for the [Default Remuneration Component](#tag/Default-Remuneration-Components).

name.description: Name given to this [Default Remuneration Component](#tag/Default-Remuneration-Components). This name would normally be shown to users of the system.

value.description: The value of this remuneration component. For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly add to the total.

isInUse.description: Whether this [Default Remuneration Component](#tag/Default-Remuneration-Components) is used as any remuneration components.

automaticallyAddToJobs.description: Whether this [Default Remuneration Component](#tag/Default-Remuneration-Components) is automatically added to newly created/updated jobs.

isEnabled.description: If this [Default Remuneration Component](#tag/Default-Remuneration-Components) is enabled for use in the system.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this [Default Remuneration Component](#tag/Default-Remuneration-Components). An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

type.description: The type of this [Default Remuneration Component](#tag/Default-Remuneration-Components). Enum: `AdditionToBase`, `AdditionToTotal`, `DeductionToBase`, `Breakdown`.

valueType.description: The type of the value of this [Default Remuneration Component](#tag/Default-Remuneration-Components). Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

startDate.description:
The date this [Extended Leave](#tag/extended-leave) started or will start. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

endDate.title: RFC3339 datetime
endDate.description:
The date this [Extended Leave](#tag/extended-leave) is expected to end. Leave is created without a finalised return date. In order to create more than one Extended Leave on a Job, the end date must be finalised on the most recent created Extended Leave. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

Multiple keys can be used together to further narrow search results.

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

startDate.title: RFC3339 datetime
startDate.description:
The start date of the attribute, or null for start of job. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

awardName.example: MA000065: Professional Employees Award 2010 - Fair Work Commission

link.description: Link on the public api to get more information on this piece of data.

remunerationSchedule.description: The current remuneration details for this [Job](#tags/Jobs), including information such as salary and hourly pay, all [Jobs](#tags/Jobs) have a remuneration schedule but for unpaid employees they will have a special `No Remuneration Schedule` schedule.

type.description: The method in which this remuneration schedule is paid, if a person is unpaid then this will be `No Remuneration Schedule`. Enum: `Annual Salary`, `Hourly Rate`, `No Remuneration Schedule`.

baseAnnualSalary.description: The Base Salary paid yearly, this is an approximation if they are paid hourly. Note that if both baseAnnualSalary and baseHourlyRate are provided in a create or patch request, the baseHourlyRate will be ignored.

baseHourlyRate.description: The Base Rate paid hourly, this is an approximation if they are paid annually. Note that if both baseAnnualSalary and baseHourlyRate are provided in a create or patch request, the baseHourlyRate will be ignored.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency that the base and total amounts that this job is being paid in. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

hoursPerCycle.description:
How many hours worked per payCycle. 

 0 (zero) signifies that the hours are variable per pay cycle

payCycle.description: The cycle that the job is paid on. Enum: `Weekly`, `Fortnightly`, `Monthly`, `Bi-Monthly`.

annualPackage.description: The total package paid yearly including additions and deductions. This amount is calculated by adding the Base Annual Salary and additions minus the deductions.

hourlyPackage.description: The total package paid hourly including additions and deductions. This amount is calculated by dividing the Annual Package by the total number of hours per annum.

currencyConversionOccurred.description: If any conversion had to be performed between addition and deduction currencies when calculating the annual package.

employmentCondition.description: The [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions) this job is being paid under. **Deprecated** Please use the job-level employmentCondition field instead.

id.title: UUIDv4
id.description: The identifier string for the [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions) of this Remuneration Schedule.

name.description: Name given to this [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions). This name would normally be shown to users of the system.

awardName.description: Award name can be different from the name presented to a user. Usually used for the legal name of the award.
awardName.example: MA000065: Professional Employees Award 2010 - Fair Work Commission

link.title: URL
link.description: Link on the public api to get more information on this piece of data.

additions.description: An array of Additions for this Remuneration Schedule.

name.description: The name of this Addition.

type.description: How this addition is calculated and applied to the base amount, multipleOfBase is multiplied by baseAnnualSalary and then added to the total while fixed amount is added directly to the total. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier (e.g. 9 = 9%) while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly add to the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Addition. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

deductions.description: An array of Deductions for this Remuneration Schedule. Note that this deductions value has been deprecated, you should now use `breakdowns`

name.description: The name of this Deduction.

type.description: How this deduction is calculated and applied to the base amount, multipleOfBase is multiplied by baseAnnualSalary and then deducted from the total while fixed amount is deducted directly from the total. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly deduct from the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Deduction. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

additionsToTotal.description: An array of Additions applied to the package after all other components for this Remuneration Schedule.

name.description: The name of this Total Addition.

type.description: How this total addition is calculated and applied to the base amount, multipleOfBase is multiplied by baseAnnualSalary and then added to the total while fixed amount is added directly to the total. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier (e.g. 9 = 9%) while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly add to the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Addition. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

breakdowns.description: An array of Breakdowns for this Remuneration Schedule. Breakdowns will not be used to calculate the total package.

name.description: The name of this Addition.

type.description: How this addition is recorded, it is not used to compute the total package due unlike other remuneration components. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier (e.g. 9 = 9%) while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly add to the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Addition. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

customFields.description: The custom field values for this Remuneration Schedule

positionStartDate.title: RFC3339 datetime
positionStartDate.description:
The start date of the current position the person is in. The gap between the `companyStartDate` and `positionStartDate` will be filled with "Previous position title" historical records, to correctly depict the person as having no information recorded for old job positions. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

companyStartDate.title: RFC3339 datetime
companyStartDate.description: The date this [Job](#tags/jobs) started or will start within the organisation. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

companyEndDate.title: RFC3339 datetime
companyEndDate.description: The exclusive date this [Job](#tags/jobs) ended or will end within the organisation. For example, if the person's last working date is on 2025-04-23, the `companyEndDate` should be set as 2025-04-24 to reflect the exclusive date. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

isEndDateConfirmed.description: Whether the end date has been finalised within the intelliHR application.

turnoverType.description: The type of turnover this end of job is classified as.

turnoverReason.description: The name of the turnover reason.

baseAnnualSalary.description: The Base Salary paid yearly, this is an approximation if they are paid hourly. Note that if both baseAnnualSalary and baseHourlyRate are provided in a create or patch request, the baseHourlyRate will be ignored.

baseHourlyRate.description: The Base Rate paid hourly, this is an approximation if they are paid annually. Note that if both baseAnnualSalary and baseHourlyRate are provided in a create or patch request, the baseHourlyRate will be ignored.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency that the base and total amounts that this job is being paid in. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

hoursPerCycle.description:
How many hours worked per payCycle. 

 0 (zero) signifies that the hours are variable per pay cycle

payCycle.description: The cycle that the job is paid on. Enum: `Weekly`, `Fortnightly`, `Monthly`, `Bi-Monthly`.

annualPackage.description: The total package paid yearly including additions and deductions. This amount is calculated by adding the Base Annual Salary and additions minus the deductions.

hourlyPackage.description: The total package paid hourly including additions and deductions. This amount is calculated by dividing the Annual Package by the total number of hours per annum.

currencyConversionOccurred.description: If any conversion had to be performed between addition and deduction currencies when calculating the annual package.

employmentCondition.description: The [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions) this job is being paid under. **Deprecated** Please use the job-level employmentCondition field instead.

id.title: UUIDv4
id.description: The identifier string for the [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions) of this Remuneration Schedule.

name.description: Name given to this [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions). This name would normally be shown to users of the system.

awardName.description: Award name can be different from the name presented to a user. Usually used for the legal name of the award.
awardName.example: MA000065: Professional Employees Award 2010 - Fair Work Commission

link.title: URL
link.description: Link on the public api to get more information on this piece of data.

additions.description: An array of Additions for this Remuneration Schedule.

name.description: The name of this Addition.

type.description: How this addition is calculated and applied to the base amount, multipleOfBase is multiplied by baseAnnualSalary and then added to the total while fixed amount is added directly to the total. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier (e.g. 9 = 9%) while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly add to the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Addition. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

deductions.description: An array of Deductions for this Remuneration Schedule. Note that this deductions value has been deprecated, you should now use `breakdowns`

name.description: The name of this Deduction.

type.description: How this deduction is calculated and applied to the base amount, multipleOfBase is multiplied by baseAnnualSalary and then deducted from the total while fixed amount is deducted directly from the total. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly deduct from the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Deduction. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

additionsToTotal.description: An array of Additions applied to the package after all other components for this Remuneration Schedule.

name.description: The name of this Total Addition.

type.description: How this total addition is calculated and applied to the base amount, multipleOfBase is multiplied by baseAnnualSalary and then added to the total while fixed amount is added directly to the total. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier (e.g. 9 = 9%) while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly add to the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Addition. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

breakdowns.description: An array of Breakdowns for this Remuneration Schedule. Breakdowns will not be used to calculate the total package.

name.description: The name of this Addition.

type.description: How this addition is recorded, it is not used to compute the total package due unlike other remuneration components. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier (e.g. 9 = 9%) while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly add to the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Addition. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

workType.description: This is the [Work Classification](#tag/Work-Types) for this [Job](#tag/Jobs), it is used to differentiate between full-time and part time employees vs unpaid volunteers. Enum: `Permanent`, `Fixed Contract`, `Unpaid`, `Temporary/Casual`, `Independent Contract`.

isPrimaryJob.description: Whether this job is the primary job on the [Person](#tag/People). Only one job on a [Person](#tag/People) can be primary at a time.

id.description: The identifier string for the Id of this [user](#tag/Users).

link.description: Link on the public api to get more information on this piece of data.

updatedBy.description: The last [User](#tags/users) who updated this job. May be null for old [Jobs](#tags/jobs). This field will remain null if the last update was performed by the API.

positionStartDate.title: RFC3339 datetime
positionStartDate.description:
The start date of the current position the person is in. The gap between the `companyStartDate` and `positionStartDate` will be filled with "Previous position title" historical records, to correctly depict the person as having no information recorded for old job positions. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

companyStartDate.title: RFC3339 datetime
companyStartDate.description: The date this [Job](#tags/jobs) started or will start within the organisation. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

companyEndDate.title: RFC3339 datetime
companyEndDate.description: The exclusive date this [Job](#tags/jobs) ended or will end within the organisation. For example, if the person's last working date is on 2025-04-23, the `companyEndDate` should be set as 2025-04-24 to reflect the exclusive date. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

isEndDateConfirmed.description: Whether the end date has been finalised within the intelliHR application.

turnoverType.description: The type of turnover this end of job is classified as.

turnoverReason.description: The name of the turnover reason.

customFields.description: The custom field values for this Job

createdAt.title: RFC3339 datetime
createdAt.description: When this record was created. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

meta.description: Contains miscellaneous meta information about the response.

asAt.title: RFC3339 datetime
asAt.description: The point in time for which this response is for. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

remunerationSchedule.description: The current remuneration details for this [Job](#tags/Jobs), including information such as salary and hourly pay, all [Jobs](#tags/Jobs) have a remuneration schedule but for unpaid employees they will have a special `No Remuneration Schedule` schedule.

type.description: The method in which this remuneration schedule is paid, if a person is unpaid then this will be `No Remuneration Schedule`. Enum: `Annual Salary`, `Hourly Rate`, `No Remuneration Schedule`.

baseAnnualSalary.description: The Base Salary paid yearly, this is an approximation if they are paid hourly. Note that if both baseAnnualSalary and baseHourlyRate are provided in a create or patch request, the baseHourlyRate will be ignored.

baseHourlyRate.description: The Base Rate paid hourly, this is an approximation if they are paid annually. Note that if both baseAnnualSalary and baseHourlyRate are provided in a create or patch request, the baseHourlyRate will be ignored.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency that the base and total amounts that this job is being paid in. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

hoursPerCycle.description:
How many hours worked per payCycle. 

 0 (zero) signifies that the hours are variable per pay cycle

payCycle.description: The cycle that the job is paid on. Enum: `Weekly`, `Fortnightly`, `Monthly`, `Bi-Monthly`.

annualPackage.description: The total package paid yearly including additions and deductions. This amount is calculated by adding the Base Annual Salary and additions minus the deductions.

hourlyPackage.description: The total package paid hourly including additions and deductions. This amount is calculated by dividing the Annual Package by the total number of hours per annum.

currencyConversionOccurred.description: If any conversion had to be performed between addition and deduction currencies when calculating the annual package.

employmentCondition.description: The [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions) this job is being paid under. **Deprecated** Please use the job-level employmentCondition field instead.

id.title: UUIDv4
id.description: The identifier string for the [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions) of this Remuneration Schedule.

name.description: Name given to this [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions). This name would normally be shown to users of the system.

awardName.description: Award name can be different from the name presented to a user. Usually used for the legal name of the award.
awardName.example: MA000065: Professional Employees Award 2010 - Fair Work Commission

link.title: URL
link.description: Link on the public api to get more information on this piece of data.

additions.description: An array of Additions for this Remuneration Schedule.

name.description: The name of this Addition.

type.description: How this addition is calculated and applied to the base amount, multipleOfBase is multiplied by baseAnnualSalary and then added to the total while fixed amount is added directly to the total. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier (e.g. 9 = 9%) while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly add to the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Addition. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

deductions.description: An array of Deductions for this Remuneration Schedule. Note that this deductions value has been deprecated, you should now use `breakdowns`

name.description: The name of this Deduction.

type.description: How this deduction is calculated and applied to the base amount, multipleOfBase is multiplied by baseAnnualSalary and then deducted from the total while fixed amount is deducted directly from the total. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly deduct from the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Deduction. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

additionsToTotal.description: An array of Additions applied to the package after all other components for this Remuneration Schedule.

name.description: The name of this Total Addition.

type.description: How this total addition is calculated and applied to the base amount, multipleOfBase is multiplied by baseAnnualSalary and then added to the total while fixed amount is added directly to the total. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier (e.g. 9 = 9%) while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly add to the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Addition. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

breakdowns.description: An array of Breakdowns for this Remuneration Schedule. Breakdowns will not be used to calculate the total package.

name.description: The name of this Addition.

type.description: How this addition is recorded, it is not used to compute the total package due unlike other remuneration components. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier (e.g. 9 = 9%) while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly add to the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Addition. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

type.description: How this addition is calculated and applied to the base amount, MultipleOfBase is multiplied by baseAnnualSalary and then added to the total while FixedAmount is added directly to the total. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For MultipleOfBase this is the multiplier (e.g. 9 = 9%) while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly add to the total. Any number exceeding 8 decimal places will be rounded up.

additionalProperties.description: Custom fields will be keyed by their api_name. Custom fields are not required, and any existing model defined custom fields will default to having null values.

value.description: The value for this custom field. This value structure will depend upon the type of the custom field.

anyOf.description: The value will be null when a custom field is not provided or is empty for a record. Null can be provided to delete a custom field value.
For TEXT and NUMBER records, the value is stored as a string with the value of the record.

label.description: For SINGLE_SELECT records, the value is stored as an object with the label of the dropdown option. NOTE: Only the label needs to be provided. `id` is not required.

labels.description: For MULTI_SELECT records, the value is stored as an object with an array of labels for all selected options. NOTE: Only the labels need to be provided. `ids` is not required.

remunerationSchedule.description: The current remuneration details for this [Job](#tags/Jobs), including information such as salary and hourly pay, all [Jobs](#tags/Jobs) have a remuneration schedule but for unpaid employees they will have a special `No Remuneration Schedule` schedule.

type.description: The method in which this remuneration schedule is paid, if a person is unpaid then this will be `No Remuneration Schedule`. Enum: `Annual Salary`, `Hourly Rate`, `No Remuneration Schedule`.

baseAnnualSalary.description: The Base Salary paid yearly, this is an approximation if they are paid hourly. Note that if both baseAnnualSalary and baseHourlyRate are provided in a create or patch request, the baseHourlyRate will be ignored.

baseHourlyRate.description: The Base Rate paid hourly, this is an approximation if they are paid annually. Note that if both baseAnnualSalary and baseHourlyRate are provided in a create or patch request, the baseHourlyRate will be ignored.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency that the base and total amounts that this job is being paid in. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

hoursPerCycle.description:
How many hours worked per payCycle. 

 0 (zero) signifies that the hours are variable per pay cycle

payCycle.description: The cycle that the job is paid on. Enum: `Weekly`, `Fortnightly`, `Monthly`, `Bi-Monthly`.

annualPackage.description: The total package paid yearly including additions and deductions. This amount is calculated by adding the Base Annual Salary and additions minus the deductions.

hourlyPackage.description: The total package paid hourly including additions and deductions. This amount is calculated by dividing the Annual Package by the total number of hours per annum.

currencyConversionOccurred.description: If any conversion had to be performed between addition and deduction currencies when calculating the annual package.

employmentCondition.description: The [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions) this job is being paid under. **Deprecated** Please use the job-level employmentCondition field instead.

id.title: UUIDv4
id.description: The identifier string for the [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions) of this Remuneration Schedule.

name.description: Name given to this [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions). This name would normally be shown to users of the system.

awardName.description: Award name can be different from the name presented to a user. Usually used for the legal name of the award.
awardName.example: MA000065: Professional Employees Award 2010 - Fair Work Commission

link.title: URL
link.description: Link on the public api to get more information on this piece of data.

additions.description: An array of Additions for this Remuneration Schedule.

name.description: The name of this Addition.

type.description: How this addition is calculated and applied to the base amount, multipleOfBase is multiplied by baseAnnualSalary and then added to the total while fixed amount is added directly to the total. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier (e.g. 9 = 9%) while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly add to the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Addition. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

deductions.description: An array of Deductions for this Remuneration Schedule. Note that this deductions value has been deprecated, you should now use `breakdowns`

name.description: The name of this Deduction.

type.description: How this deduction is calculated and applied to the base amount, multipleOfBase is multiplied by baseAnnualSalary and then deducted from the total while fixed amount is deducted directly from the total. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly deduct from the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Deduction. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

additionsToTotal.description: An array of Additions applied to the package after all other components for this Remuneration Schedule.

name.description: The name of this Total Addition.

type.description: How this total addition is calculated and applied to the base amount, multipleOfBase is multiplied by baseAnnualSalary and then added to the total while fixed amount is added directly to the total. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier (e.g. 9 = 9%) while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly add to the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Addition. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

breakdowns.description: An array of Breakdowns for this Remuneration Schedule. Breakdowns will not be used to calculate the total package.

name.description: The name of this Addition.

type.description: How this addition is recorded, it is not used to compute the total package due unlike other remuneration components. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier (e.g. 9 = 9%) while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly add to the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Addition. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

comments.description: An array of comment objects that annotate the reason for [Job](#tag/Jobs) changes. Will be an empty array when there has been no updates to the Job.

id.title: UUIDv4
id.description: The identifier string for the Job Comment.

date.title: RFC3339 datetime
date.description:
The date this Job Comment was created. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

description.description: A further description of the Job Change Reason.

jobChangeReason.description: The [Job Change Reason](#tag/Job-Change-Reasons) used in the system to document the reason for the change.

link.description: Link on the public api to get more information on this piece of data.

workType.description: This is the [Work Classification](#tag/Work-Types) for this [Job](#tag/Jobs), it is used to differentiate between full-time and part time employees vs unpaid volunteers. Enum: `Permanent`, `Fixed Contract`, `Unpaid`, `Temporary/Casual`, `Independent Contract`.

isPrimaryJob.description: Whether this job is the primary job on the [Person](#tag/People). Only one job on a [Person](#tag/People) can be primary at a time.

jobStatus.description: The current status of this job within this organisation. Enum: `Past Job`, `Future Job`, `Ending Job`, `Current Job`.

link.description: Link on the public api to get more information on this piece of data.

id.title: UUIDv4
id.description: The identifier string for the Id of this [user](#tag/Users).

link.title: URL
link.description: Link on the public api to get more information on this piece of data.

updatedBy.description: The last [User](#tags/users) who updated this job. May be null for old [Jobs](#tags/jobs). This field will remain null if the last update was performed by the API.

positionStartDate.title: RFC3339 datetime
positionStartDate.description:
The start date of the current position the person is in. The gap between the `companyStartDate` and `positionStartDate` will be filled with "Previous position title" historical records, to correctly depict the person as having no information recorded for old job positions. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

companyStartDate.title: RFC3339 datetime
companyStartDate.description: The date this [Job](#tags/jobs) started or will start within the organisation. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

companyEndDate.title: RFC3339 datetime
companyEndDate.description: The exclusive date this [Job](#tags/jobs) ended or will end within the organisation. For example, if the person's last working date is on 2025-04-23, the `companyEndDate` should be set as 2025-04-24 to reflect the exclusive date. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

isEndDateConfirmed.description: Whether the end date has been finalised within the intelliHR application.

turnoverType.description: The type of turnover this end of job is classified as.

turnoverReason.description: The name of the turnover reason.

customFields.description: The custom field values for this Job

createdAt.title: RFC3339 datetime
createdAt.description: When this record was created. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

effectiveFrom.title: RFC3339 datetime
effectiveFrom.description:
The date this [Job](#tags/jobs) Update is effective from within the organisation. Note that this doesn't affect the start date of the overall job itself. A `null` value will indicate that this Update is effective from the start of the [Job](#tags/jobs). This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

effectiveTo.title: RFC3339 datetime
effectiveTo.description:
The date this [Job](#tags/jobs) Update is effective to within the organisation. Note that this doesn't affect the end date of the overall job itself. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

For TEXT and NUMBER records, the value is stored as a string with the value of the record.

label.description: For SINGLE_SELECT records, the value is stored as an object with the label of the dropdown option. NOTE: Only the label needs to be provided. `id` is not required.

labels.description: For MULTI_SELECT records, the value is stored as an object with an array of labels for all selected options. NOTE: Only the labels need to be provided. `ids` is not required.

startDate.title: RFC3339 datetime
startDate.description:
The start date of the attribute, or null for start of job. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

awardName.example: MA000065: Professional Employees Award 2010 - Fair Work Commission

link.description: Link on the public api to get more information on this piece of data.

remunerationSchedule.description: The current remuneration details for this [Job](#tags/Jobs), including information such as salary and hourly pay, all [Jobs](#tags/Jobs) have a remuneration schedule but for unpaid employees they will have a special `No Remuneration Schedule` schedule.

type.description: The method in which this remuneration schedule is paid, if a person is unpaid then this will be `No Remuneration Schedule`. Enum: `Annual Salary`, `Hourly Rate`, `No Remuneration Schedule`.

baseAnnualSalary.description: The Base Salary paid yearly, this is an approximation if they are paid hourly. Note that if both baseAnnualSalary and baseHourlyRate are provided in a create or patch request, the baseHourlyRate will be ignored.

baseHourlyRate.description: The Base Rate paid hourly, this is an approximation if they are paid annually. Note that if both baseAnnualSalary and baseHourlyRate are provided in a create or patch request, the baseHourlyRate will be ignored.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency that the base and total amounts that this job is being paid in. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

hoursPerCycle.description:
How many hours worked per payCycle. 

 0 (zero) signifies that the hours are variable per pay cycle

payCycle.description: The cycle that the job is paid on. Enum: `Weekly`, `Fortnightly`, `Monthly`, `Bi-Monthly`.

annualPackage.description: The total package paid yearly including additions and deductions. This amount is calculated by adding the Base Annual Salary and additions minus the deductions.

hourlyPackage.description: The total package paid hourly including additions and deductions. This amount is calculated by dividing the Annual Package by the total number of hours per annum.

currencyConversionOccurred.description: If any conversion had to be performed between addition and deduction currencies when calculating the annual package.

employmentCondition.description: The [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions) this job is being paid under. **Deprecated** Please use the job-level employmentCondition field instead.

id.title: UUIDv4
id.description: The identifier string for the [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions) of this Remuneration Schedule.

name.description: Name given to this [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions). This name would normally be shown to users of the system.

awardName.description: Award name can be different from the name presented to a user. Usually used for the legal name of the award.
awardName.example: MA000065: Professional Employees Award 2010 - Fair Work Commission

link.title: URL
link.description: Link on the public api to get more information on this piece of data.

additions.description: An array of Additions for this Remuneration Schedule.

name.description: The name of this Addition.

type.description: How this addition is calculated and applied to the base amount, multipleOfBase is multiplied by baseAnnualSalary and then added to the total while fixed amount is added directly to the total. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier (e.g. 9 = 9%) while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly add to the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Addition. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

deductions.description: An array of Deductions for this Remuneration Schedule. Note that this deductions value has been deprecated, you should now use `breakdowns`

name.description: The name of this Deduction.

type.description: How this deduction is calculated and applied to the base amount, multipleOfBase is multiplied by baseAnnualSalary and then deducted from the total while fixed amount is deducted directly from the total. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly deduct from the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Deduction. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

additionsToTotal.description: An array of Additions applied to the package after all other components for this Remuneration Schedule.

name.description: The name of this Total Addition.

type.description: How this total addition is calculated and applied to the base amount, multipleOfBase is multiplied by baseAnnualSalary and then added to the total while fixed amount is added directly to the total. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier (e.g. 9 = 9%) while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly add to the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Addition. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

breakdowns.description: An array of Breakdowns for this Remuneration Schedule. Breakdowns will not be used to calculate the total package.

name.description: The name of this Addition.

type.description: How this addition is recorded, it is not used to compute the total package due unlike other remuneration components. Enum: `MultipleOfBase`, `FixedAmount`.

value.description: For multipleOfBase this is the multiplier (e.g. 9 = 9%) while for fixed amount this is the amount to directly add to the total.

currency.title: Currency code
currency.description: The currency used for this Addition. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

updatedBy.description: The last [User](#tags/users) who updated this job. May be null for old [Jobs](#tags/jobs). This field will remain null if the last update was performed by the API.

positionStartDate.title: RFC3339 datetime
positionStartDate.description:
The start date of the current position the person is in. The gap between the `companyStartDate` and `positionStartDate` will be filled with "Previous position title" historical records, to correctly depict the person as having no information recorded for old job positions. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

companyStartDate.title: RFC3339 datetime
companyStartDate.description: The date this [Job](#tags/jobs) started or will start within the organisation. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

companyEndDate.title: RFC3339 datetime
companyEndDate.description: The exclusive date this [Job](#tags/jobs) ended or will end within the organisation. For example, if the person's last working date is on 2025-04-23, the `companyEndDate` should be set as 2025-04-24 to reflect the exclusive date. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

isEndDateConfirmed.description: Whether the end date has been finalised within the intelliHR application.

turnoverType.description: The type of turnover this end of job is classified as.

turnoverReason.description: The name of the turnover reason.

customFields.description: The custom field values for this Location

additionalProperties.description: Custom fields will be keyed by their api_name. Custom fields are not required, and only provided custom fields will be updated.

value.description: The value for this custom field. This value structure will depend upon the type of the custom field.

anyOf.description: The value will be null when a custom field is not provided or is empty for a record. Null can be provided to delete a custom field value.
For TEXT and NUMBER records, the value is stored as a string with the value of the record.

label.description: For SINGLE_SELECT records, the value is stored as an object with the label of the dropdown option. NOTE: Only the label needs to be provided. `id` is not required.

labels.description: For MULTI_SELECT records, the value is stored as an object with an array of labels for all selected options. NOTE: Only the labels need to be provided. `ids` is not required.

person.description:
For PEOPLE_DROPDOWN records, the value is an object with an array of the [Person](#tag/People) search object and their [Job](#tag/Jobs) search object. This [Person](#tags/people) is specified as a search object, which will match the person who best fits the keys for this object.
      Multiple keys can be used together to further narrow search results (for example, if there are multiple people with the same name, email address
      can be used as well to limit to a single person. A validation error will be thrown if this search is unable to be narrowed to a single [Person](#tags/people).

primaryEmailAddress.description: The email address flagged as primary for the [Person](#tags/people) within the system.

employeeNumber.description: A manually entered employee number that identifies a [Person](#tags/people) in intelliHR. It may be hidden in the system's UI depending upon your tenant's configuration.

autoIncrementingIntellihrId.description: An autogenerated number that uniquely identifies a [Person](#tags/people) in intelliHR. It may be hidden in the system's UI depending upon your tenant's configuration.

job.description: The [Job](#tag/Jobs) information of the [Person](#tag/People) is mandatory if the target PEOPLE_DROPDOWN custom field allows selecting individual jobs. If not, The [Job](#tag/Jobs) information is not mandatory.

effectiveFrom.title: RFC3339 datetime
effectiveFrom.description:
The date this [Pay Grade](#tags/Pay-Grades) Update is effective from within the organisation. Note that this doesn't affect the availableFrom date of the overall Pay Grade itself.  Not providing an effectiveFrom will apply the changes from the beggining of time.. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

effectiveTo.title: RFC3339 datetime

The date this [Pay Grade](#tags/Pay-Grades) Update is effective to within the organisation.. This date will follow the format defined by [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6).

 YYYY-MM-DD date formatting is also supported, although by using this format the date will be stored as the start of day in UTC time, not the requesting tenants timezone.

code.description: Administrative, short code associated to the [Pay Grade](#tag/Pay-Grades).

description.description: Description of the [Pay Grade](#tag/Pay-Grades).

employmentCondition.description:
The [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions) this job is being paid under.
         This [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions) is specified as a search object, which will match the employment condition which best fits the keys for this object. Multiple keys can be used together to further narrow search results.

id.title: UUIDv4
id.description: The identifier string for the [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions) of this Remuneration Schedule.

name.description: Name given to this [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions).

awardName.description: Award name can be different from the name presented to a user. Usually used for the legal name of the award.
awardName.example: MA000065: Professional Employees Award 2010 - Fair Work Commission

payGradeType.description: The type of this [Pay Grade](#tag/Pay-Grades). Enum: `FIXED` or `STEP`.

isOverridable.description: Allow this [Pay Grade](#tag/Pay-Grades) value to be overwritten.

permanentHourlyRate.description: Stores the hourly rate for permanent [Jobs](#tag/Jobs). These inputs will be ignored if you also pass in pay Step values.

permanentHourlyRateCurrency.title: Currency code
permanentHourlyRateCurrency.description: The currency that the permanentHourlyRate is being paid in. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

casualHourlyRate.description: Stores the hourly rate for casual [Jobs](#tag/Jobs). These inputs will be ignored if you also pass in pay Step values.

casualHourlyRateCurrency.title: Currency code
casualHourlyRateCurrency.description: The currency that the casualHourlyRate is being paid in. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

annualSalary.description: Stores the annual salary for [Jobs](#tag/Jobs). These inputs will be ignored if you also pass in pay Step values.

annualSalaryCurrency.title: Currency code
annualSalaryCurrency.description: The currency that the annualSalary is being paid in. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

paySteps.description: An array of Paygrade Step Rates. This will replace the current Pay Steps with a new list.  Providing an `id` for an existing Pay Step will update that record instead of createing a new Pay Step.

id.title: UUIDv4
id.description: The identifier string for the Pay Grade Step.  Providing an `id` will update an existing step.  Not providing an `id` will create a new step under the Pay Grade..

name.description: The name assigned to this [Pay Grade](#tags/Pay-Grades) Step.

permanentHourlyRate.description: Stores the hourly rate for permanent [Jobs](#tag/Jobs) for this Step.

permanentHourlyRateCurrency.title: Currency code
permanentHourlyRateCurrency.description: The currency that the permanentHourlyRate is being paid in. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

casualHourlyRate.description: Stores the hourly rate for casual [Jobs](#tag/Jobs) for this Step.

casualHourlyRateCurrency.title: Currency code
casualHourlyRateCurrency.description: The currency that the casualHourlyRate is being paid in. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

annualSalary.description: Stores the annual salary for [Jobs](#tag/Jobs) for this Step.

annualSalaryCurrency.title: Currency code
annualSalaryCurrency.description: The currency that the annualSalary is being paid in. An international currency code. Typically AUD for Australian dollar, USD for American dollar etc. See [Official list of codes](https://www.iban.com/currency-codes).

preferredName.description: The [Person's](#tags/people) Preferred Name. Can generally be configured by employees for themselves.

gender.description: Human readable string for the [Person's](#tags/people) gender, e.g. `Male`. Searching is done case-insensitively and 'starts-with' e.g. passing `male` will match with a [Gender](#tags/genders) called "Male" as will "m" or "M". If multiple [Genders](#tags/genders) match the first will be chosen. The gender options available are: `Female`, `Male`, `Non-binary`, `Other`, `Undisclosed`.

employeeNumber.description: A manually entered employee number that identifies a [Person](#tags/people) in intelliHR. It may be hidden in the system's UI depending upon your tenant's configuration.

title.description: The title to refer to this [Person](#tags/people) as, for example "Mr". This is null if not provided and is case insensitive.

emergencyContact.description: The details for this [Person's](#tags/people) emergency contact.

name.description: The name of the emergency contact.

relationship.description: The relationship this emergency contact has with the [Person](#tags/people).

phone.description: Phone number of the emergency contact.

primaryEmailAddress.description: Information about this [Person's](#tags/people) primary email address, or null if they have no email information.  The provided email address will be converted to lowercase. The field is also required when creating a user alongside with the person.

email.description: The actual email address. This will be automatically converted to lowercase.

isPersonal.title: Is Personal
isPersonal.description: Denotes whether this email is personal or a work email.

primaryPhoneNumber.description: Information about this [Person's](#tags/people) primary phone number, or null if they have no phone information.

phone.description: The actual phone number. This number can be prefixed with an area code. When this happens, the system will automatically try to determine the origin country for the phone number

number.description: The actual phone number. This number can be prefixed with an area code. When this happens, the system will automatically try to determine the origin country for the phone number

isPersonal.title: Is Personal
isPersonal.description: Denotes whether this phone is personal or a work phone number.

emailAddresses.description: Information about this [Person's](#tags/people) email addresses. This will replace all of their current emails. The provided email addresses will be converted to lowercase. Note that a [Person](#tags/people) must have at least one primary email address.

email.description: The email address associated with this person. This will be automatically converted to lowercase.

isPersonal.title: Is Personal
isPersonal.description: Denotes whether this email is personal or a work email.

isPrimary.description: Denotes whether this email is the primary contact email.

customFields.description: The custom field values for this email address

additionalProperties.description: Custom fields will be keyed by their api_name. Custom fields are not required, and any existing model defined custom fields will default to having null values.

value.description: The value for this custom field. This value structure will depend upon the type of the custom field.

anyOf.description: The value will be null when a custom field is not provided or is empty for a record. Null can be provided to delete a custom field value.
For TEXT and NUMBER records, the value is stored as a string with the value of the record.

label.description: For SINGLE_SELECT records, the value is stored as an object with the label of the dropdown option. NOTE: Only the label needs to be provided. `id` is not required.

labels.description: For MULTI_SELECT records, the value is stored as an object with an array of labels for all selected options. NOTE: Only the labels need to be provided. `ids` is not required.

person.description:
For PEOPLE_DROPDOWN records, the value is an object with an array of the [Person](#tag/People) search object and their [Job](#tag/Jobs) search object. This [Person](#tags/people) is specified as a search object, which will match the person who best fits the keys for this object.
      Multiple keys can be used together to further narrow search results (for example, if there are multiple people with the same name, email address
      can be used as well to limit to a single person. A validation error will be thrown if this search is unable to be narrowed to a single [Person](#tags/people).

id.description: The identifier string for the [Person](#tags/people) to locate in the system.

name.description: The name of the [Person](#tags/people) in intelliHR to search for. Note that the search accounts for differences in name order automatically.

primaryEmailAddress.description: The email address flagged as primary for the [Person](#tags/people) within the system.

employeeNumber.description: A manually entered employee number that identifies a [Person](#tags/people) in intelliHR. It may be hidden in the system's UI depending upon your tenant's configuration.

autoIncrementIntellihrId.description: An autogenerated number that uniquely identifies a [Person](#tags/people) in intelliHR. It may be hidden in the system's UI depending upon your tenant's configuration.

autoIncrementingIntellihrId.description: An autogenerated number that uniquely identifies a [Person](#tags/people) in intelliHR. It may be hidden in the system's UI depending upon your tenant's configuration.

job.description: The [Job](#tag/Jobs) information of the [Person](#tag/People) is mandatory if the target PEOPLE_DROPDOWN custom field allows selecting individual jobs. If not, The [Job](#tag/Jobs) information is not mandatory.

fullAddress.description: The full readable address, minus the postcode and country.  This value will be resolved against Google maps api and will populate the state, suburb and street if a match is found.  You can override these results if you also pass the corresponding fields you wish to set.

country.description: The country the address is in.

state.description: The state the address is in. This field is required if the fullAddress field is not provided.

street.description: The street the address is on. This field is required if the fullAddress field is not provided.

suburb.description: The suburb the address is in. This field is required if the fullAddress field is not provided.

isPrimary.description:
Denotes whether this address is the primary. By default, the first address in the array 
              will be set as the primary if all addresses are set with isPrimary: false.

rotation.description: the degree to rotate the image from 0-359

coordinates.description:
The coordinates to crop the image.

If `PERSON_PROFILE` is selected, the image will be stretched to an aspect ratio of 1:1 in IHR platform. Hence it is recommended to crop the image with an aspect ratio of 1:1 to avoid distortions. As an example for a `3000x4000` image to cropped to 1:1, the height can be modified to a value of 3000px which corresponds to the ratio `height=widthpx/heightpx=3000/4000=0.75`. For the height of image to be cropped in the center, vertical offset can be defined as `y=(1-height)/2=0.125`. With the following example, coordinates of `{ x: 0, y: 0.125, width: 1, height: 0.75}` will result in a square image that is cropped from the center.

If `PROFILE_COVER` is selected, the image will be stretched to an aspect ratio of 3:1 in IHR platform. As an example to avoid distortions, we can use the following formula for the new height `newHeightpx=widthpx/3`. The new height ratio will be defined as `height=newHeightpx/heightpx`. The vertical offset can be adjusted using `y=(1-height)/2` for the image height to be cropped from the center.

height.description: the multiple to crop the height of the image to (e.g. 0.5 will half the height)

width.description: the multiple to crop the width of the image to (e.g. 0.5 will half the width)

x.description: the multiple to offset the x crop (e.g. 0.5 will crop to show the right side of the image if the width is also 0.5)

y.description: the multiple to offset the y crop (e.g. 0.5 will crop to show the bottom of the image if the height is also 0.5)

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
Filters can be applied in the query string to limit the data returned from this endpoint. Filters are provided in the format `filters[<filter_name>][<operation_type>]=<filter_value>`.For example, a filter to get items matching a specific filter value would be `filters[identifier][eq]=Engineering`
Below is a list of operation types available on filters, note that each filter may not support every type:
 Equality `[eq]`: Checks for an exact match with the given filter value
The list of supported filters is given below.

identifier.description:
The customer identifier given to a [Business Unit](#tags/Business-Units) in the system. This filter checks for an exact string match with any part of a [Business Units](#tags/Business-Units) identifier. If multiple [Business Units](#tags/Business-Units) match the `<filter_value>`, they will all be returned.
Example filter: `filters[identifier][eq]=Engineering`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

name.description:
Name of a [Business Unit](#tags/Business-Units) in the system. This filter checks for an exact string match with any part of a [Business Units](#tags/Business-Units) name. If multiple [Business Units](#tags/Business-Units) match the `<filter_value>`, they will all be returned.
Example filter: `filters[name][eq]=Engineering`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

get.description: Returns a list of all [Business Units](#tag/Business-Units) recorded in the system.
Returns a single [Business Unit](#tag/Business-Units).

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
Filters can be applied in the query string to limit the data returned from this endpoint. Filters are provided in the format `filters[<filter_name>][<operation_type>]=<filter_value>`.For example, a filter to get items matching a specific filter value would be `filters[modelType][eq]=TRAINING`
Below is a list of operation types available on filters, note that each filter may not support every type:
 Equality `[eq]`: Checks for an exact match with the given filter value
The list of supported filters is given below.

modelType.description:
The model that this custom field relates to and can be attached to. Enum: `ADDRESS`, `BUSINESS_ENTITY`, `BUSINESS_UNIT`, `EMAIL_ADDRESS`, `JOB`, `LOCATION`, `PERSON`, `POSITION_TITLE`, `PHONE_NUMBER`, `REMUNERATION`, `TRAINING`.
Example filter: `filters[modelType][eq]=TRAINING`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

isEnabled.description:
If the custom field is disabled in the intelliHR platform or not
Example filter: `filters[isEnabled][eq]=true`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
Filters can be applied in the query string to limit the data returned from this endpoint. Filters are provided in the format `filters[<filter_name>][<operation_type>]=<filter_value>`.For example, a filter to get items matching a specific filter value would be `filters[personId][eq]=dc996d73-a75e-499c-a96e-bd7d0df45f57,26d0ffc4-60f6-4672-a603-caaa4564af12`
Below is a list of operation types available on filters, note that each filter may not support every type:
 Equality `[eq]`: Checks for an exact match with the given filter value
The list of supported filters is given below.

personId.title: UUIDv4
personId.description:
The identifier string for the [Person](#tags/People). This can be chained by `,` to search for multiple jobs
Example filter: `filters[personId][eq]=dc996d73-a75e-499c-a96e-bd7d0df45f57,26d0ffc4-60f6-4672-a603-caaa4564af12`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

personName.description:
The name for the [Person](#tags/People) to whom the [Job](#tags/Jobs) belongs.
Example filter: `filters[personName][eq]=Batman`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

primaryEmail.description:
The email address flagged as primary for the [Person](#tags/People) to whom the [Job](#tags/Jobs) belongs.
Example filter: `filters[primaryEmail][eq]=bruce.wayne@example.com`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

employeeNumber.description:
The employee number for the [Person](#tags/People) to whom the [Job](#tags/Jobs) belongs.
Example filter: `filters[employeeNumber][eq]=00001`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

autoIncrementIntellihrId.description:
The autogenerated number that uniquely identifies [Person](#tags/People) in intelliHR to whom the [Job](#tags/Jobs) belongs.
Example filter: `filters[autoIncrementIntellihrId][eq]=1000`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

jobId.description:
The identifier string for the [Job](#tag/Jobs). This can be chained by `,` to search for multiple jobs
Example filter: `filters[jobId][eq]=dc996d73-a75e-499c-a96e-bd7d0df45f57,26d0ffc4-60f6-4672-a603-caaa4564af12`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

jobName.description:
The name/position title for the [Job](#tag/Jobs).
Example filter: `filters[jobName][eq]=Food%20Scientist`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

jobNameAsAt.description:
The date to filter jobName. This filter should be used in conjunction with jobName filter above. If not provided, it defaults to today.
Example filter: `filters[jobNameAsAt][eq]=2020-10-08T22%3A30%3A00%2B00%3A00`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

jobStatus.description:
The current status of this [Job](#tags/jobs) within this organisation. Enum: `Past Job`, `Future Job`, `Ending Job`, `Current Job`.
Example filter: `filters[jobStatus][eq]=Current%20Job`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

jobEndingWithin.description:
The amount of days including today to filter jobs with an upcoming end date.
Example filter: `filters[jobEndingWithin][eq]=14`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

jobEndedWithin.description:
The amount of days including today to filter jobs that have already ended.
Example filter: `filters[jobEndedWithin][eq]=14`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

updatedWithin.description:
The amount of days including today to filter updated jobs.
Example filter: `filters[updatedWithin][eq]=14`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

workType.description:
The name of the current [Work Type](#tag/Work-Types) for the job.
Example filter: `filters[workType][eq]=Fixed%20Contract`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

isPrimaryJob.description:
Whether this job is the primary job on the [Person](#tag/People). Parse 'true' to filter primary job. Parse 'false' for non-primary job
Example filter: `filters[isPrimaryJob][eq]=true`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

employmentConditionId.title: UUIDv4
employmentConditionId.description:
The identifier string for the current [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions) of the job.
Example filter: `filters[employmentConditionId][eq]=8a5f3ea6-ea6b-4425-8a87-3c256bb7b6f9`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

parameters.title: asAt configuration
parameters.description:
Used to configure what date to return this job data for, as a [RFC3339](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339#section-5.6) datetime. 

All data returned from the job endpoints represent the values of the Person's job attributes at a specific point in time. 

By default, the current datetime is used, but this parameter can be used to configure a different datetime to see historical data.

parameters.name: filters
parameters.description:
Filters can be applied in the query string to limit the data returned from this endpoint. Filters are provided in the format `filters[<filter_name>][<operation_type>]=<filter_value>`.For example, a filter to get items matching a specific filter value would be `filters[jobId][eq]=dc996d73-a75e-499c-a96e-bd7d0df45f57,26d0ffc4-60f6-4672-a603-caaa4564af12`
Below is a list of operation types available on filters, note that each filter may not support every type:
 Equality `[eq]`: Checks for an exact match with the given filter value
The list of supported filters is given below.

jobId.title: UUIDv4
jobId.description:
The identifier string for the [Job](#tag/Jobs). This can be chained by `,` to search for current jobs that belong to multiple [people](#tag/People).
Example filter: `filters[jobId][eq]=dc996d73-a75e-499c-a96e-bd7d0df45f57,26d0ffc4-60f6-4672-a603-caaa4564af12`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

primaryEmailAddress.description:
This Person's primary email address.
Example filter: `filters[primaryEmailAddress][eq]=bruce.wayne@batman.org`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

employeeNumber.description:
A manually entered employee number that identifies a [Person](#tags/people) in intelliHR. It may be hidden in the system's UI depending upon your tenant's configuration.
Example filter: `filters[employeeNumber][eq]=00001`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

autoIncrementIntellihrId.description:
An autogenerated number that uniquely identifies a [Person](#tags/people) in intelliHR. It may be hidden in the system's UI depending upon your tenant's configuration.
Example filter: `filters[autoIncrementIntellihrId][eq]=1000`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

name.description:
Name of a [Person](#tags/people) in the system. This filter checks for an exact string match with any part of a [Persons](#tags/people) name. This filter is performed case insensitively and regardless of name order (e.g. `<last_name> <first_name>`). If multiple [People](#tags/people) match the `<filter_value>`, they will all be returned.
Example filter: `filters[name][eq]=Batman%20(Bruce)%20Wayne`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

updatedWithin.description:
Filters people that have been updated within the specified amount of days.
Example filter: `filters[updatedWithin][eq]=30`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation

isOnExtendedLeave.description:
Filters people that are on extended leave. Parse 'true' to filter for people on extended leave. Parse 'false' for people not on extended leave
Example filter: `filters[isOnExtendedLeave][eq]=true`
This filter supports the equality `[eq]` operation
