get.description: Returns a single [Workflow Event](#tag/Workflow-events) by its identifier.
get.summary: Find a Workflow Event by ID

parameters.description: The id of the Workflow to trigger.
parameters.name: id

schema.title: UUIDv4
schema.description: The identifier string for the id.

patch.description:
Trigger a Workflow and related Workflow Form Designs. 

This endpoint supports Workflows that are linked to Job onboarding, offboarding, role change and extended leave.

Currently the recipient and email address type for the individual forms will be automatically set based on the Respondent Type on the Form Design.  Form Designs with a Respondent Type of `Supervisor` for a job with no supervisor currently are not supported as no default option can be selected.

get.description: Returns a list of all [Work Rights](#tag/Work-Rights) recorded in the system.
Returns a single work right.
get.summary: Find a Work Right by ID

get.description: Returns a list of all [Work Types](#tag/Work-Types) recorded in the system.
Returns a single work type.
get.summary: Find a Work Type by ID

get.description: Returns a list of all [Webhook Events](#tag/Webhook-Events).
Returns a single [Webhook Event](#tag/Webhook-Events).
get.summary: Find a Webhook Event by ID

get.description: Returns a list of all webhooks.
Returns a single webhook.

tags.name: Business Entities
tags.description: [Business Entities](#tag/Business-Entities) represent the legal entities which exist within the organisation. A [Business Entity](#tag/Business-Entities) can be used as a filter for automation logic (eg Pulse configuration) and as a dimension in the analytics tools. Every [Job](#tag/Jobs) in the system belongs to a [Business Entity](#tag/Business-Entities).

tags.name: Business Units
tags.description: The administrative units that exist within the organisation. Used to render the org chart business unit view. For example, "Finance", "HR", or "Information Technology". [Business Units](#tag/Business-Units) can be configured as text strings with parent -> child relationships. Every [Job](#tag/Jobs) in the system belongs to a [Business Unit](#tag/Business-Units).

tags.name: Custom Field Definitions
tags.description: Custom Field Definitions can be used to attach extra data fields to particular models in the system such as [Training](#tag/Trainings).

tags.name: Default Remuneration Components
tags.description: [Default Remuneration Components](#tag/Default-Remuneration-Components) are the organization-wide remuneration components for both additions and breakdowns.

tags.name: Employment Conditions
tags.description: Employment conditions are the conditions under which someone is paid for their remuneration schedule. Every [Job](#tag/Jobs) in the system belongs to a [Employment Condition](#tag/Employment-Conditions) or the `No Employment Condition` Employment Condition.

tags.name: Extended Leave
tags.description: [Extended Leave](#tag/extended-leave) can be added to an existing [Job](#tag/jobs).  Only one Extended Leave without a confirmed return date can on a Job at any one time.

tags.name: Extended Leave Types
tags.description: [Extended Leave Types](#tag/extended-leave-types) are used in the system when adding [Extended Leave](#tag/extended-leave) to a Job.

tags.name: Forms
tags.description: [Forms](#tag/Forms) represent the actionable forms which exist within the organisation and are sent to the users of the system.

tags.name: Job Change Reasons
tags.description: [Job Change Reasons](#tag/Job-Change-Reasons) are used in the system to document the reason for changes to a [Job](#tag/jobs).

tags.name: Job Requirement Groups
tags.description: [Job Requirement Groups](#tag/Job-Requirement-Groups) are qualification requirements that a job must fulfill.

tags.name: End Job
tags.description: Set and finalise the end date of a job. Finalising a job changes it to a past job on the end date.

tags.name: Jobs
tags.description:
The Job object is the core data object for past, current and future roles that a Person holds in the organisation. A Person can have more than one Job at a point in time to represent secondment / role sharing.
The data returned from this endpoint represents the data at this current time, which may change over time due to scheduled changes. This endpoint returns the [Job's](#tag/Jobs) Remuneration Schedule.
Establishment fields are currently in testing and require your tenant to be flagged for usage.

tags.name: Job Timeline
tags.description: [Job Timeline](#tag/Job-Timeline) show upcoming changes and current information about a [Job](#tag/Jobs).

tags.name: Locations
tags.description: Locations can be configured as text strings with parent -> child relationships. For example, `Australia` -> `Brisbane` -> `Spring Hill Head Office`. These locations are used for filtering in analytics. Every [Job](#tag/Jobs) in the system belongs to a [Location](#tag/Locations) or the `No Location` Location.

tags.name: Pay Grades
tags.description: Pay Grades are optional attributes applied to a job to provide a salary range for analytical purposes. These are configurable for admins in the intelliHR application. Every [Job](#tag/Jobs) in the system belongs to a [Pay Grade](#tag/Pay-Grades) or the `No Pay Grade` Pay Grade.

tags.name: People
tags.description: People represent the base objects in the intelliHR data model. All past, present and future employees should be created as a Person and then have a Job created which references that Person object. Contact information for the employee (eg emergency contact, phone numbers, email addresses, etc) is referenced to the Person object. While Jobs can have scheduled updates which will take effect in the future, People are always static in the system and will not change unless updated.

tags.name: People Images
tags.description: [People Images](#tag/People-Images) are used to assign and update Images to an existing [Person](#tag/People).

tags.name: People Skills
tags.description: [People Skills](#tag/People-Skills) are used to assign and update [Skills](#tag/Skills) to an existing [Person](#tag/People).

tags.name: Permission Groups
tags.description: [Permission Groups](#tag/Permission-Groups).

tags.name: People Documents
tags.description:
[People Document](#tag/People-Documents) is an object which represents the document stored in the "Documents" tab in Person Profile in intelliHR system. You can upload a document through this API by following the steps below.

1. Create a presigned upload URL which enables you to upload a document to S3 by using [Create a presigned upload URL](#tag/Person-Documents/paths/~1people-documents/post) endpoint.
2. Upload a document to the S3 presigned URL with HTTP PUT method.
3. Mark the upload status successful with [Update a Document](#tag/Person-Documents/paths/~1people-documents~1{id}/patch) endpoint.

These steps can be automatically handled by [Zapier](https://zapier.com/apps/intellihr/integrations) "Upload Person Document" action.

tags.name: Person Documents (deprecated)
tags.description:
Note that this has been deprecated, it is recommended to use [People Document](#tag/People-Documents)
[Person Document](#tag/Person-Documents) is an object which represents the document stored in the "Documents" tab in Person Profile in intelliHR system. You can upload a document through this API by following the steps below.

1. Create a presigned upload URL which enables you to upload a document to S3 by using [Create a presigned upload URL](#tag/Person-Documents/paths/~1person-documents/post) endpoint.
2. Upload a document to the S3 presigned URL with HTTP PUT method.
3. Mark the upload status successful with [Update a Document](#tag/Person-Documents/paths/~1person-documents~1{id}/patch) endpoint.

These steps can be automatically handled by [Zapier](https://zapier.com/apps/intellihr/integrations) "Upload Person Document" action.

tags.name: Position Titles
tags.description: Position Titles that exist within the organisation. Position Title are assigned to [Jobs](#tag/jobs).

tags.name: Qualification Instances
tags.description: [Qualification Instance](#tag/Qualification-Instances) represents an instance of a qualification library item.

tags.name: Qualification Statuses
tags.description: [Qualification Status](#tag/Qualification-Statuses) represents the current status of the qualification instance.

tags.name: Qualification Library Items
tags.description: [Qualification Library Item](#tag/Qualification-Library-Items) represent a type of qualification. E.g. A Drivers license.

tags.name: Qualification Types
tags.description: [Qualification Type](#tag/Qualification-Types) represent a type of qualification. E.g. A License

tags.name: Recruitment Sources
tags.description: Recruitment sources refer to the origin of this employee, such as a job board or a recruitment agency. These are configured as text strings in the intelliHR application and are used as filters for analytical purposes. [Recruitment Sources](#tag/Recruitment-Sources) can be configured as text strings with parent -> child relationships.

tags.name: Representative Types
tags.description: [Representative Type](#tag/Representative-Types) represent a type of representative for a certain intelliHR Object type.

tags.name: Skills
tags.description: [Skills](#tag/Skills) are used to catalogue the Skills available in the organisation and whether they are business critical.  Skills are categorised into groups with each belonging to a parent [Skill Discipline](#tag/Skill-Disciplines).  Skills can be assigned to a [Person](#tag/People) to facilitate the tracking of competencies across teams and the organisation.

tags.name: Skill Disciplines
tags.description: Skill Disciplines that exist within the organisation. Skill Disciplines are used to categorise [Skills](#tag/skills) and can contain multiple child skills.

tags.name: Training Providers
tags.description: [Training Providers](#tag/Training-Providers) are used in the system to document what/who provided the [Training](#tag/trainings).

tags.name: Trainings
tags.description: [Trainings](#tag/Trainings) are used in the system to store details about individual training events.

tags.name: Training Statuses
tags.description: [Training Statuses](#tag/Training-Statuses) are used in the system to define the progress of a [Training](#tag/Trainings) record.

tags.name: Training Types
tags.description: [Training Types](#tag/Training-Types) are used in the system to document the category of a [Training](#tag/Trainings) record.

tags.name: Users
tags.description:
A [User](#tag/Users) account gives employees access to the intelliHR platform and is linked to an existing Person.
  A Person can exist without a User, as employees can still complete tasks sent to their primary email address.

tags.name: Work Classes
tags.description: Work Classes are a sub-class of Work Types. For example, the `Permanent` Work Type has both `Full-Time` and `Part-Time` Work Classes. These are used for to configure automation and analytics filters. Every [Job](#tag/Jobs) in the system belongs to a [Work Class](#tag/Work-Classes).

tags.name: Workflow Events
tags.description:
A [Workflow Events](#tag/Workflow-events) is a triggered event within the intelliHR platform, associated to certain events such as job changes (eg onboarding, offboarding, going on extended leave), or by specific events (eg a training event).

[Workflows](#tag/Workflows) can be created within intelliHR and assigned under a specific Workflow Event.

tags.name: Workflows
tags.description:
A [Workflow](#tag/workflows) is a pre-set schedule of tasks that will be assigned to various people at different points in time.

They are triggered by an action within the system and all the tasks created relate to a single subject person.
Workflows use the date of an action or change in the system as a starting point to calculate when forms are assigned. Multiple WorkFlows can be part of the same [Workflow Event](#tag/Workflow-events).

tags.name: Work Rights
tags.description: [Work Rights](#tag/Work-Rights) are the organization-wide work rights.

tags.name: Work Types
tags.description: Work Types represent the primary work classification for a job. It is one of the types `Permanent`, `Fixed Contract`, `Unpaid` or `Temporary/Casual`. This attribute is always used with the Work Class attribute which is a sub class of Work Type. Every [Job](#tag/Jobs) in the system belongs to a [Work Type](#tag/Work-Types).

tags.name: Webhook Events
tags.description:
[Webhook Events](#tag/Webhook-Events) are hardcoded events which occur within the intelliHR platform which can be subscribed to using [Webhooks](#tag/Webhooks).

  As an example, person.created is a [Webhook Event](#tag/Webhook-Events), which can trigger a [Webhook](#tag/Webhooks) when a [Person](#tag/People) is created within the platform.

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description:
[Webhooks](#tag/Webhooks) are used in the system to allow developers and integration platforms (such as [Zapier](https://zapier.com/)) to subscribe to a [Webhook Event](#tag/Webhook-Events), such as a person.updated or person.created event. When the [Webhook Event](#tag/Webhook-Events) is triggered, the system will send a payload to the endpoint specified when creating the [Webhook](#tag/Webhooks). These [Webhooks](#tag/Webhooks) follow the [Rest Hook](https://resthooks.org/) pattern. # Event Types The following properties are always returned for every payload and event type. An event type may include more properties than this.
Please check the specific event/s you would like to implement for the full schema. ## job.created Fired when a job has been created. ## job.deleted Fired when a job has been deleted. ## job.updated **This event does not fire anymore, please update your implementation.**
~~Fired when a job has been updated.~~ ## job.update_scheduled Fired when an update has been scheduled for a job. ## job.timeline_updated Fired on the day when an update of the job has taken into effect. Eg. if a job update is scheduled for 31/03/2025, this event will fire on 31/03/2025. Similarly, if there is a job update in the present date, this event also will fire. ## job.ended Fired when when the job has been ended. ## job.end_date_adjusted Fires when when the job end date has been adjusted, but before being finalised. ## job.end_date_finalised Fired when when the job end date has been finalised. ## job.end_date_cancelled Fired when when a job end date that had been finalised, was cancelled. ## job.effective_dates_updated Fires when when the effective dates of the job have been updated. ## job.company_start_date_upcoming Fires at set offsets before and including the job company start date. ## job_remuneration.update_scheduled Fired when an update has been scheduled for a jobs remuneration. ## person.birthday_upcoming Fired at certain intervals before a persons birthday and the date of their birthday. Intervals are 1 month before, 14 days before, 7 days before, 3 days before, 1 day before and on the day of. ## person.created Fired when a person has been created. ## person.deleted Fired when a person has been deleted. ## person.updated Fired when a person has been updated. ## training.created Fired when a training is created. ## training.deleted Fired when a training has been deleted. ## training.updated Fired when a training has been updated. ## form.created Fired when an instance of a form has been created. ## form.completed Fired when a instance of a form has been completed. ## user.created Fired when a user has been created. ## user.deleted Fired when a user has been deleted. ## user.disabled Fired when a user has been disabled. ## user.disabled_upcoming Fired at set offsets before the user is scheduled to be disabled. ## user.updated Fired when a user has been updated. ## qualification.instance_created Fired when a qualification instance has been created. ## qualification.instance_updated Fired when a qualification instance has been updated.
